intro: Eriospermum confertum, commonly known as the clustered eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in compact clusters. Eriospermum confertum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
